intro: Fumana laevis subsp. juniperina, commonly known as the Juniperine Fumana, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are typically finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. This subspecies is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
